description:
Do you want your work to make a difference for NSW? 


Together, we create thriving environments, communities and economies. 


 



Opportunity to shape and lead the Department’s archival strategy 
Temporary 12 month full-time opportunity with the possibility for extension or conversion to ongoing, 35 hrs per week 
Office location is flexible within NSW; hybrid working supported 
Salary relative to experience, and ranges from $125,693to $138,510 plus super and leave loading (Clerk Grade 9/10) 



 


At the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) we are currently seeking to appoint a strategic and detail-oriented Senior Archivist to deliver records and information services programs that support compliant and sustainable information management.  


 


About the role 


In this role, you will provide expert advice on the retention, disposal, and transfer of records and information, and lead the development and implementation of archival systems that preserve the department’s organisational history and ensure compliance. 


This role is central to ensuring compliance with legislative requirements, preserving records of historical and operational value, and enhancing access to key documentation across the organisation. 


You will work closely with the Director and Records Manager to provide strategic input into records and information management planning, including the integration of IT systems. from retention through to secure disposal. A key part of your role will also involve promoting and delivering archival training programs to facilitate the consistent capture of both inactive and active records into the Department's records management system. You will also ensure governance frameworks are embedded, while maintaining compliance with legislative and regulatory requirements. 


This role is ideal for someone who enjoys building systems from the ground up, thrives on challenge, and is ready to shape the future of our archival services. 


 


About You 


The successful candidate will: 



Bring strong expertise in archival and records management, including retention and disposal
Be adaptable and organised, with the ability to manage competing priorities 
Demonstrate excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills 
Act as a subject matter expert in archival compliance and best practices 
Provide strategic input into records and information management, including IT integration 
Have experience using EDRMS (preferably Compass, Content Manager) and applying disposal schedules 
Be knowledgeable about emerging trends and technologies in records and information management 





 


Essential requirements 

Tertiary qualifications in information management or other relevant field and/or equivalent knowledge and substantial experience in the IT and /or records management industry 
Demonstrated knowledge of the State Records Act 1998, AS ISO 15489, and other relevant compliance frameworks 
Strong experience managing the full lifecycle of records, including retention and disposal 



Nice to have 



Familiarity with Compass or other mapping systems
Government or public sector experience 
Experience building or refining archival services in complex or transitioning environments 



For more information read the full Role Description: Senior Archivist 


 


Who we are 


The Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) works to protect the State’s environment and heritage. It leads the way on climate change, driving the sustainable transition to a net zero economy, powered by affordable, reliable, and clean energy. 




DCCEEW conserves and protects the state’s natural environment. It manages the NSW national park estate, including its rich and diverse biodiversity and Aboriginal cultural heritage for future generations. 


DCCEEW also ensures sustainable management of water resources across the state, to support the environment, communities and industry. 


We acknowledge the ongoing custodial responsibilities of the Aboriginal peoples of NSW to care for Country and water and are committed to establishing meaningful partnerships with Aboriginal peoples in the management of the environment.
